com.skobbler.ngx.map

Class SKMapFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Fragment
      • com.skobbler.ngx.map.SKMapFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener

    public class SKMapFragment
extends android.app.Fragment
    Class that represents a Map component in an app. This fragment automatically handles the map view's necessary life cycle.

    This component can be added the following ways:

    1)Initialize the SKMaps framework with the steps described at SKMaps and add the fragment to the XML file

    - Declare the fragment inside the activity's layout file:

    - Initialize the instance of the MapFragment class, this will associate the Map with the MapFragment declared in the xml file. Only after it is initialized, the MapFragment UI element will contain a Map object. 

     
 SKMapFragment mapFragment =
 (SKMapFragment)getFragmentManager().findFragmentById( R.id.mapfragment);
 mapFragment.initialise();
    2) Initialize the SKMaps framework with the steps described at SKMaps and programmatically add the fragment to an existing ViewGroup. 
     
 SKMapFragment mapFragment = new SKMapFragment();
 FragmentTransaction fragmentTransaction = getFragmentManager().beginTransaction();
 fragmentTransaction.add(R.id.fragmentContainer, mapFragment).commit();
